item.title: Melissa add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Dear old world', she murmured, 'you are very lovely, and I am glad to be alive in you." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Life is to be enjoyed, not endured" -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Melissa add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "I am simply a 'book drunkard.' Books have the same irresistible temptation for me that liquor has for its devotee. I cannot withstand them." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Thomas S. Monson
item.description: "Never let a problem to be solved, become more important than a person to be loved." -- Thomas S. Monson

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Forget yourself and get to work." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "When one door of happiness closes, another opens; but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us." -- Helen Keller
